pros: Culture, work/life balance, autonomy, training and development, pay is very fair based on size of the organization, promotes from within, communication
cons: Being a non-profit and smaller company, pay is favorable but can't compete with the big healthcare organizations. What you get is great benefits and work/life balance.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Battle Creek, MI
pros: Hours, pay, holidays, and employee appreciation
cons: Poor communication, was hired to do a job and ended up being trained for a completely different job then what was in job description

job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker in Kalamazoo, MI
pros: Autonomy Flexibility Decent Pay Great Mission
cons: Short staffing Work life balance due to short staffing
Management lacking ethics and community skills.

job_title: Corporate Team Member in Portage, MI
pros:
Everyone organization has prickly points at times, but what really matters in my experience is a strong connection to the mission and a deep compassion for people. This is true for Senior Care Partners. Some legacy struggles with leadership & management, but the current team is working hard and doing the right things to help support the staff and rebuild trust. If you like making a difference in a growing, mission-driven, culture-focused organization.

PTO for everyone even part-time, excellent medical coverage and price options, paid holidays, mission-driven, culture-focused
cons: Some people appear to be recovering from past experiences that are no longer issues, workloads can seem heavy if you have a hard time prioritizing, but overall everything is pretty great.

review_title: We Have a Team of Fabulous Caregivers
pros: I've been in this organization for almost a decade and have seen lots of growth and change over the years. The one thing that never changes is the spirit of passion our employees have for the population we serve. At the end of the day, we have a team of fabulous caregivers from many different disciplines who work together for the benefit of those we serve.
cons: Healthcare is a continually changing environment, and we work through the changes and challenges like every other healthcare provider.

pros: Interdisciplinary Team; exceptional geriatric care; a lot of hands-on experience during internships and fieldwork positions.
cons: Some placements are still a combination of virtual and onsite.

pros:
Making a difference everyday 
Working with world-class talent
Having variety in your work day 
Serving the community to allow the elderly to age in place at their home and not nursing home 
Nominated three years in a row as a Great Place To Work
cons:
Not enough time in the day to get all the great work done when you are passionate about what you do
Being the best kept secret (more people need to know about our services and great place to work)

pros: Fantastic mission with an employee base that is passionate and rallies around it; committed servant leadership team.
cons: Complicated structure working within healthcare; best environment for problem solvers.

job_title: C N A in Marshall, MI

pros: Very well organized company. There is plenty of room to advance. Management is open to suggestions from employees at all levels. Benefits are very good.
cons: With a growing company it is important to keep employees up to date with changes, which was done at meetings but sometimes changes occurred faster than the scheduled staff meetings, I cases as such it would have been nice to have a open forum or notice of changes prior to the set meetings even though it didn't always directly affect certain work groups it was still nice to know why things were occurring differently than previously.
